TM 2.0M7 Testing

RSE install  : I20070517-0600
java.runtime : Sun 1.5.0_11-b03
os.name:     : Windows XP, Service Pack 2
------------------------------------------------

The SystemMessage should be shown in a dialog rather than getting logged.

SystemMessageDialog.showError() and similar static methods can be used for this easily: they even switch to the dispatch thread automatically. What's important is that the call to the SystemMessageDialog is done in the UI part of RSE (i.e. in the original action that caused the operation in the Subsystem, and not inside SubSystem itself).

We want to make the SubSystem code non-UI at some point, and we want it to be well usable programmatically. Therefore, all SubSystem calls just throw exceptions, and messages are to be displayed from the UI client.
We should be able to prevent this scenario with the fix for bug 187130.  Nevertheless we should address SystemMessageExceptions via show error.
Note that I fixed all the static methods in SystemMessageDialog.display*() in order to switch to the Display thread if needed. So fixing this could be very simple.

Created an attachment (id=69966)
Disable logging of SystemMessageException

This patch will just disable the logging of the SystemMessageException.  I did not implement the calling of the SystemMessageDialog.display()* because an Error Message is already displayed to the user ("No authority or file name not valid").

I, Rupen Mardirossian, declare that I developed attached code from
scratch, without referencing any 3rd party materials except material licensed
under the EPL. I am authorized by my employer, IBM Canada Ltd. to make this
contribution under the EPL.
Martin, since the message is already displayed, all we needed to do is not log the message.  So this patch simply comments out the code that logs it.  Could you review?
Patch is good. There is no sense logging a message for something that's displayed in the wizard already.

traces.message: No authority or file name not valid
